title: 1,300-Mile 1996 Dodge Viper GTS
description: This 1996 Dodge Viper GTS was first delivered to Vicksburg Chrysler Plymouth Dodge in Vicksburg, Michigan, and it shows 1,300 miles following registration history in Michigan, Arizona, and California. It is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Viper GTS Blue with white stripes over black leather. The car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 17" five-spoke alloy wheels, projector-style headlights, an Alpine CD stereo, air conditioning, and power windows. This Viper GTS is now offered by the selling dealer in Texas with a window sticker, the owner's manual, and a clean California title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1,300-Mile 1996 Dodge Viper GTS at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #191,169.
text: This 1996 Dodge Viper GTS was first delivered to Vicksburg Chrysler Plymouth Dodge in Vicksburg, Michigan, and it shows 1,300 miles following registration history in Michigan, Arizona, and California. It is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Viper GTS Blue with white stripes over black leather. The car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 17″ five-spoke alloy wheels, projector-style headlights, an Alpine CD stereo, air conditioning, and power windows. This Viper GTS is now offered by the selling dealer in Texas with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, and a clean California title. The car is finished in Viper GTS Blue with white stripes and features projector-style headlights, fog lights, a vented hood, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. The 17″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot SX tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs. The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather along with a color-matching dashboard, center console, door panels, and shift knob. Additional equipment includes adjustable pedals, power windows, and dual airbags. An Indianapolis 500 badge is affixed to the dashboard. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. Auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage are mounted atop the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 1,300 miles. The 8.0-liter OHV V10 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 490 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T-56 six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Vicksburg Chrysler Plymouth Dodge in Vicksburg, Michigan, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $69,300. html:
This 1996 Dodge Viper GTS was first delivered to Vicksburg Chrysler Plymouth Dodge in Vicksburg, Michigan, and it shows 1,300 miles following registration history in Michigan, Arizona, and California. It is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission and is finished in Viper GTS Blue with white stripes over black leather. The car is equipped with a limited-slip differential, 17″ five-spoke alloy wheels, projector-style headlights, an Alpine CD stereo, air conditioning, and power windows. This Viper GTS is now offered by the selling dealer in Texas with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, and a clean California title.

The car is finished in Viper GTS Blue with white stripes and features projector-style headlights, fog lights, a vented hood, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets.

The 17″ five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot SX tires. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs.

The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather along with a color-matching dashboard, center console, door panels, and shift knob. Additional equipment includes adjustable pedals, power windows, and dual airbags. An Indianapolis 500 badge is affixed to the dashboard.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. Auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage are mounted atop the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 1,300 miles.

The 8.0-liter OHV V10 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 490 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T-56 six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Vicksburg Chrysler Plymouth Dodge in Vicksburg, Michigan, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $69,300.

The Carfax report shows at least one open manufacturer safety recall.
